In his 1906 book Aequanimitus, Osler emphasized that medicine is the “only world-wide profession following the same methods, actuating the same ambitions, and pursuing the same ends.” He emphasized that this “homogeneity” or “solidarity” which physicians world-wide are witnessing today with the COVID-19 pandemic is a quality “not shared by law” or politics, that “allows physicians to practice the same art amid the same surroundings in every country on earth.”
8 This unity of effort is not seen in other professions, and is witnessed today with the wide support given by medical colleagues from other countries, all cooperating on essential clinical and public health research.
